```{r jump-detection, echo=F}
# 1. Load Summary
summary_path <- here::here("data-raw", "outputs", "02_aggregated_summary", "02_aggregated_summary.csv.gz")
dt_summary <- data.table::fread(summary_path)
data.table::setorder(dt_summary, momentum)

dt_summary <- dt_summary[momentum > 0.0]

# 2. Sensitivity-based Jump Detection
# Now working only with the physical data range
z_diffs <- abs(diff(dt_summary$zurek_entropy_median))
threshold <- max(z_diffs, na.rm = TRUE) * 0.0001
jump_indices <- which(z_diffs > threshold)

# 3. Dynamic Build with Integer Plateau logic
jumps <- lapply(seq_along(jump_indices), function(i) {
  idx <- jump_indices[i]
  m_at <- dt_summary$momentum[idx + 1]
  # Logic: Plateau below at floor - 0.1, Plateau above at ceiling + 0.1
  list(
    n = paste("Transition", i),
    p_vals = c(
      m_at-1,
      m_at,       
      m_at+1
      # floor(m_at),
      # m_at,       
      # ceiling(m_at)
    )
  )
})

p_markers <- dt_summary$momentum[jump_indices]
```

```{r introduction, child = 'inst/readme/introduction.Rmd'}
```
### Fit Statistics: Holographic Theory ($E \propto \sqrt{P}$)

The quantitative analysis of the physical data ($P \ge 1.0$) provides strong 
evidence that the **Landauer Energy** best
aligns with the hypothesized **holographic principle** scaling.

```{r landauer-analysis, echo=FALSE}
# 1. Define Energy Scaling
landauer_factor <- 1 

plot_dt <- dt_summary[momentum >= 1.0, .(
  momentum = as.numeric(momentum),
  y_mean   = as.numeric(kolmogorov_complexity_mean) * landauer_factor,
  y_med    = as.numeric(kolmogorov_complexity_median) * landauer_factor,
  y_sd     = as.numeric(kolmogorov_complexity_sd) * landauer_factor
)]

# 2. Calculate Fit Statistics
k_fit    <- mean(plot_dt$y_mean / sqrt(plot_dt$momentum), na.rm = TRUE)
theory   <- k_fit * sqrt(plot_dt$momentum)
ss_total <- sum((plot_dt$y_mean - mean(plot_dt$y_mean))^2)
ss_res   <- sum((plot_dt$y_mean - theory)^2)

stats_df <- data.frame(
  Metric = "Landauer vs Holographic",
  k_constant = round(k_fit, 3),
  R_squared = round(1 - (ss_res / ss_total), 4),
  Correlation_R = round(cor(plot_dt$y_mean, theory), 4),
  RMSE = round(sqrt(mean((plot_dt$y_mean - theory)^2)), 4)
)

# Render Table
knitr::kable(stats_df, row.names = FALSE)
```

```{r plot-landauer-energy, fig.width=8, fig.height=8, echo=FALSE}
# 3. Visualization
plot_dt[, theory := k_fit * sqrt(momentum)]
plot_dt[, residuals := y_mean - theory]

norm_p_title = latex2exp::TeX("Normalized Momentum $p / \\sqrt{(m h \\omega) / 2\\pi}$")
holographic_label = latex2exp::TeX("Holographic Projection $\\sqrt{\\bar{P}}$")

p_main <- ggplot(plot_dt, aes(x = momentum)) +
  geom_vline(xintercept = p_markers[p_markers >= 1.0], 
             color = "grey70", linetype = "dashed", alpha = 0.5) +
  geom_ribbon(aes(ymin = y_mean - y_sd, ymax = y_mean + y_sd), fill = "gray60", alpha = 0.1) +
  geom_line(aes(y = y_mean, color = "E Mean"), linewidth = 1) +
  geom_line(aes(y = y_med, color = "E Median"), linewidth = 1) +
  geom_line(aes(y = theory, color = "Holo"), linewidth = 0.75, alpha = 0.75) +
  scale_color_manual(
    values = c("E Mean" = "gray40", "E Median" = "black", "Holo" = "gray60"),
    # 2. Use the TeX object as the label for the 'Holo' key
    labels = c("E Mean" = "E Mean", "E Median" = "E Median", "Holo" = holographic_label)
  ) +
  labs(
    title = "Landauer Energy E vs. Normalized Momentum P",
    subtitle = latex2exp::TeX(paste0(
      "Holographic Projection: $\\frac{E}{k_B T \\ln 2} \\approx \\sqrt{\\bar{P}}$ ",
      "($k = ", stats_df$k_constant, "$, $R^2 = ", stats_df$R_squared, "$)"
    )),
    x = norm_p_title,
    y = latex2exp::TeX("Landauer Energy $k_B T \\ln 2$"),
    color = "Series"
  ) +
  theme_minimal() + 
  theme(legend.position = "bottom", axis.text.x = element_blank())  

p_res <- ggplot(plot_dt, aes(x = momentum, y = residuals)) +
  geom_bar(stat = "identity", fill = "gray60", alpha = 0.4) +
  geom_hline(yintercept = 0, color = "gray60", linetype = "solid", linewidth = 1) +
  labs(y = latex2exp::TeX("$\\frac{E}{k_B T \\ln 2} - \\sqrt{\\bar{P}}$"), x = norm_p_title) +
  theme_minimal()

p_final <- cowplot::plot_grid(p_main, p_res, ncol = 1, align = "v", rel_heights = c(3, 1))

ggplot2::ggsave(
  filename = file.path(manuscript_dir, "landauer_momentum.pdf"),
  plot = p_final, 
  width = 8, 
  height = 8, 
  device = "pdf"
)

print(p_final)
```

```{r distribution-helper, echo=FALSE}
# --- CORE PLOTTING FUNCTION ---
generate_physics_grid <- function(jumps_subset) {
  num_jumps <- length(jumps_subset)
  plot_list <- vector("list", num_jumps * 3)
  counter   <- 1

  for (j in seq_len(num_jumps)) {
    for (p in seq_along(jumps_subset[[j]]$p_vals)) {
      
      current_p <- jumps_subset[[j]]$p_vals[p]
      f_name    <- sprintf("micro_macro_erasures_P_%013.6f.csv.gz", round(current_p, 6))
      f_path    <- here::here("data-raw", "outputs", "01_micro_macro_erasures", f_name)
      
      # Physics Scaling
      action <- current_p * current_p

      if (file.exists(f_path) && current_p >= 1.0) {
        raw_fluc <- data.table::fread(f_path, select = "fluctuation")$fluctuation * action
        f_range  <- range(raw_fluc, na.rm = TRUE)
        panel_breaks <- seq(from = f_range[1], to = f_range[2], length.out = 402)
        h <- graphics::hist(raw_fluc, breaks = panel_breaks, plot = FALSE)
        
        plot_df <- data.frame(x = h$breaks[-length(h$breaks)], y = h$counts)
        
        p_obj <- ggplot2::ggplot(plot_df, ggplot2::aes(x = x, y = y)) +
          ggplot2::geom_ribbon(ggplot2::aes(ymin = 0, ymax = y), fill = "black", alpha = 0.3) +
          ggplot2::geom_step(direction = "hv", color = "black", linewidth = 0.2) +
          ggplot2::labs(
            # PRECISION FIX: 4 digits after decimal
            title = paste0(jumps_subset[[j]]$n, " at P = ", sprintf("%.3f", current_p)),
            x = "q", y = ""
          ) +
          ggplot2::theme_minimal() +
          ggplot2::theme(plot.title = ggplot2::element_text(size = 10))
      } else {
        p_obj <- ggplot2::ggplot() + 
          ggplot2::annotate("text", x = 0.5, y = 0.5, 
                            label = paste("P =", sprintf("%.3f", current_p), "\n excluded")) +
          ggplot2::theme_void()
      }
      plot_list[[counter]] <- p_obj
      counter <- counter + 1
    }
  }

  # Assemble with Patchwork
  patchwork::wrap_plots(plot_list, ncol = 3) + 
    patchwork::plot_annotation(
      title = "Automated Detection of Median Momentum Transitions",
      subtitle = "LOWER PLATEAU, TRANSITION, UPPER PLATEAU",
      theme = ggplot2::theme(
        plot.title = ggplot2::element_text(hjust = 0.5, face = "bold", size = 14),
        plot.subtitle = ggplot2::element_text(hjust = 0.5, size = 10, face = "bold")
      )
    )
}
```
